modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It focuses on awakening the hearer's desire (Vouloir) and then providing the obligation (Devoir) to pursue God to satisfy that desire.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Starts at S2 (Decay), moves to ~S1 (Idolatry as a false solution), then to S1 (God as refuge), and finally to ~S2 (Resurrection as the negation of decay).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension between the desire for permanence and the reality of decay is resolved through the historical fact of the resurrection.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the sermon emphasizes the second law of thermodynamics and the loss of all emotional foundations.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon is grounded in the 'Grace' of the resurrection, the actantial structure is heavily anthropocentric. The hearer is the Subject who must 'pursue,' 'run,' and 'say' to achieve the object of security. God is the Object to be pursued rather than the Subject who pursues.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: three important things that we are going to have to do
The only way you’ll become unshakable is to do those things but run after God.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God never let his body see decay but raised him up

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: David is used as a model for the hearer's spiritual psychology and actions.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Instead of 'Do what David did to get security,' a theocentric reading would be 'See how God secured David despite his shaking, which points to how God secures us in Christ.'

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to 'pursue' God correctly to avoid being 'shaken.'
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Faith is framed as a human performance of 'running' and 'panting' after the right object.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'work' of pursuing God to the 'fact' of the resurrection is slightly jarring actantially.
spanning_punten: The sermon tells us we must 'get' the refuge (Human Subject), but then says the resurrection 'guarantees' it (God Subject).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: We participate a little bit in God’s joy

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon relies on 'rational' evidence to provide competence rather than the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'running after the wrong things' (misdirected desire) rather than a state of death requiring a Subject-switch.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a manual for the soul to find security, making the hearer the primary actor and God the prize.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is told they must 'get' a refuge.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God is the one who 'keeps' the soul (v.1).
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'How we can get a refuge,' use 'How God becomes our refuge when our own foundations fail.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the one 'running' after God.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'faithful one' (v.10) who is 'not abandoned' by God.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Shift from the hearer's pursuit of God to God's preservation of the hearer.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that we *cannot* run after God on our own, but He has run to us in the Incarnation.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon excels at showing the futility of the world.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (Ethics/Pursuit) is treated as the means to the 'Primary Program' (Salvation/Security).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The Resurrection (Soteriology) provides the security that *then* allows us to stop running after idols (Ethics).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a powerful 'Christus Victor' ending, but the 'Three things you must do' structure pulls it back into a moralistic framework. Re-centering the verbs on God's action would transform this from a lecture on spiritual effort into a proclamation of Gospel security.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the 'hook' and the use of C.S. Lewis; a semiotic analysis reveals the hearer is burdened with the 'Subject' role.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis notes David's trust; semiotics asks if the preacher makes that trust a new Law for the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'pursuing God' can be actantially identical to 'pursuing idols' if the Subject remains the self-actualizing human.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses high-quality cultural illustrations but maintains a 'how-to' structural engine.
